parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the behaviour of the individual unit, this is why it only accepts [[Object]] as the argument. For Arma 3 behaviour explanation see [[Arma_3_AI_Behavior]]

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>  '''behaviour''' unitName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] -  
One of:
*"CARELESS"
*"SAFE"
*"AWARE"
*"COMBAT"
*"STEALTH"
*"ERROR" (Since <template><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.78</value></part></template> when used on empty vehicles and such)
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldier [[setBehaviour]] "CARELESS";
_b = [[behaviour]] _soldier; //returns "CARELESS"</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[AIBehaviour]], [[setBehaviour]], [[setWaypointBehaviour]], [[combatMode]], [[setCombatMode]], [[skill]], [[setSkill]], [[Arma 3 AI Skill]], [[setCombatBehaviour]], [[combatBehaviour]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
